title: How to Retrieve E Mail from a Computer Other Than Your Own

steps.title: Go to a mail to web service, like mail2web.com.
steps.content: Go to a mail to web service, like mail2web.com. This is by far the easiest way to access your email account from another computer. Mail to Web services, like mail2web.com, are not like web-based e-mail accounts. Instead they relay the unreceived messages from your server to a computer other than your own so you can access your mail from anywhere in world. Other popular options include hightail.com, myemail.com, and mail.com. Some services may require you to know the name of your server but mail2web.com does not.

steps.title: Type your chosen mail service into your toolbar.
steps.content: Type your chosen mail service into your toolbar. This will bring you to the website's main page.

steps.title: Input your username and password.
steps.content: Input your username and password. Occasionally, they may ask for a bit more information like your name but never anything more than that. These services should always be free and should not ask for more than your basic information. If they do, find another service.

steps.title: Log out of your account when you leave.
steps.content: Log out of your account when you leave. The Log Out option can be found in the top righthand corner of the display. Because this is not your computer, other users may be able to access your account if you do not delete your username and password.

steps.title: Exit out of your Browser.
steps.content: Exit out of your Browser. Your mail to web service will most likely prompt you to exit out of your browser and clear your cache after you log out of your account.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+Shift+Delete for Windows or Command+Shift+Delete for Mac.
steps.content: Press Ctrl+Shift+Delete for Windows or Command+Shift+Delete for Mac. This will clear your cache and ensure the security or your e-mail account.

steps.title: Be aware of the limitations.
steps.content: Be aware of the limitations. Remember that using this method with your POP, or Post office Protocol account, will only access the messages that you have received since the last time you checked your account. You may also access your messages through POP compatible programs like Mozilla Thunderbird, Outlook Express, Outlook, or Eudora. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Gather your account information.
steps.content: Gather your account information. You will need to have your IMAP server name, SMTP server name, username, password, and any ports and SSL requirements. IMAP accounts, or Internet Message Access Protocols, store all of your emails at the server, so you can retrieve them from any IMAP compatible program. These include programs like Mozilla Thunderbird, Outlook Express, Outlook, or Eudora. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Create a new account.
steps.content: Create a new account. Simply input the above names and information in any one of the IMAP compatible programs listed in Step 1. The following Steps will walk you through the process of setting up your account on Outlook 2010.

steps.title: Go to Account Settings.
steps.content: Go to Account Settings. You can do this by starting Outlook then by clicking Info in the File Menu.

steps.title: Go to the E-mail Tab.
steps.content: Go to the E-mail Tab. Click New then select E-mail Account. Once completed, click next.

steps.title: Check the box entitled Manually Configure Server Settings or Additional Server Types.
steps.content: Check the box entitled Manually Configure Server Settings or Additional Server Types.

steps.title: Select Internet E-Mail.
steps.content: Select Internet E-Mail. Then click Next.

steps.title: Set IMAP as your Account Type.
steps.content: Set IMAP as your Account Type. You can find this in the Server Information section.

steps.title: Input your information.
steps.content: Input your information. You will need to name, e-mail address, username, password, the name of your IMAP4 server, and the name of your SMTP server.

steps.title: Finishing up.
steps.content: Finishing up. After you select Next and then Finish, you may now access your message on Outlook.

steps.title: Delete the account from the program when you leave.
steps.content: Delete the account from the program when you leave. Because this is not your computer, you will want to delete your account information so that others cannot access your e-mail. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Sign onto your Gmail account.
steps.content: Sign onto your Gmail account. If you do not already have one, you can easily set one up quickly and for free.

steps.title: Access your Account Settings menu.
steps.content: Access your Account Settings menu. Look in the upper corner of your Gmail account and click the cog icon. Click on the option for Settings. Click on the Accounts tab.

steps.title: Select Add a POP3 E-mail Account You Own.
steps.content: Select Add a POP3 E-mail Account You Own. This will prompt a new window to appear where you may input your account information.

steps.title: Enter your e-mail address.
steps.content: Enter your e-mail address. This should be the e-mail address for your POP3 account and not your Gmail account. Once you have entered your e-mail address, click Next Step.

steps.title: Enter your username.
steps.content: Enter your username. Your username will usually include the domain. For example joe@domain.com rather than simply "joe."

steps.title: Enter your password.
steps.content: Enter your password. This will be the password for your POP3 account and not the password for you Gmail account.

steps.title: Set the POP Server.
steps.content: Set the POP Server. This will usually look something like mail.yourdomain.com or something like it.

steps.title: Check that the Port is set to 110.
steps.content: Check that the Port is set to 110. This is the default non-encrypted port for POP3. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Add Account.
steps.content: Click Add Account. This can be found at the bottom of the screen. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Access your messages.
steps.content: Access your messages. You will now be able to access the e-mails from your POP3 account.

steps.title: Click Account Settings.
steps.content: Click Account Settings. This can be found under the Tools Menu.

steps.title: Look under Name.
steps.content: Look under Name. Select the POP3 account that you wish to access.

steps.title: Decide your settings.
steps.content: Decide your settings. Choose if you would like to leave the mail in the server or delete them after they have been accessed. If you would like to leave them, follow click change, choose More Settings, and then go to Delivery under the Advanced Tab. If you would like the messages to be deleted from the server, proceed to the next step.

steps.title: Select the check box entitled Leave a Copy of Messages on the Server.
steps.content: Select the check box entitled Leave a Copy of Messages on the Server.

steps.title: Decide your settings.
steps.content: Decide your settings. Choose whether you would like to receive messages automatically or manually. If you would like to receive them manually, follow Steps 9 through 11. If you would like to receive messages automatically, skip to Step 12.

steps.title: Hover over the Send/Receive option under the Tools Menu.
steps.content: Hover over the Send/Receive option under the Tools Menu. This will cause a drop down box to display.

steps.title: Go to the POP3 e-mail account option.
steps.content: Go to the POP3 e-mail account option. This will prompt another drop down box.

steps.title: Click Inbox.
steps.content: Click Inbox. This will show you your new e-mail messages.

steps.title: Hover over the Send/Receive option under the Tools menu.
steps.content: Hover over the Send/Receive option under the Tools menu. This will cause a drop down box to display.

steps.title: Go to the Send/Receive Settings option.
steps.content: Go to the Send/Receive Settings option. This will prompt another box. Click Define Send/Receive Groups.

steps.title: Go to Group Name.
steps.content: Go to Group Name. Here you will click on a group that contains your POP3 e-mail account. Select Setting for Group Name.

steps.title: Set your settings.
steps.content: Set your settings. Select the check box entitled Schedule an Automatic Send/Receive Every n Minutes. This will prompt you to enter a number between 1 and 1440 indicating the time lapse you would like between receiving mail in minutes. 1440 indicated receiving mail once every 24 hours and 1 indicating once every 60 seconds. [7] X Research source
